item.title: Course Objectives
item.description: In this class we will cover advanced networking concepts and help students gain an understanding of the current network model, what it takes to connect a device to a network, and how the Internet works. By the end of the course, the students will have an understanding of network layers and basic protocols, how the Internet works able to write programs to interact with remote services hosted on the Internet.

item.title: Materials
item.description: Textbook We will be using the following books/links They are open source and you can use the online versions. Computer Networks: A Systems Approach, Larry Peterson and Bruce Davie, PDF or the HTML version. Socket Programming Book, C/C++ - Use Beejâ€™s Guide to Network Programming for socket programming introduction. Link Python Socket Programming- Link

item.title: Schedule
item.description: This is a tentative schedule and will change. Week 1 - Reading assignment for week 1 - Introduction, Chapter 1.2, and Chapter 1.3, Chapter 1.5 Programming Assignment 1 Posted January 11 - Introduction, What to Expect, Terminologies, Circuit vs Packet Switching Slides January 13 - Layers, Performance Slides Week 2- January 18 - Architectures vs Protocols, Link Layer, Socket Programming Slides January 20 - Link Layer, Socket Programming Slides Slides Jan 23 - Last day to drop class

item.title: Grading
item.description: Grading Final grade will depend on relative distribution of scores. Course Element Weight All Homeworks combined 15% Programming Assignments 35% Exams 35% Class participation 15%
